unnormalised: Someone asked me about opening a new bank account recently, and it reminded me of my own confusing experience. I had to gather so much info! First, I needed my PAN card, of course. Then, they wanted my Aadhaar number, something like 9876-5432-1012, for KYC. I was also asked for my IFSC code, something random like SBIN0001234. Felt like a secret agent mission!
normalised: Someone asked me about opening a new bank account recently, and it reminded me of my own confusing experience. I had to gather so much info! First, I needed my P-A-N card, of course. Then, they wanted my Aadhaar number, something like nine eight seven six dash five four three two dash one zero one two, for K-Y-C. I was also asked for my I-F-S-C code, something random like S-B-I-N zero zero zero one two three four. Felt like a secret agent mission!

unnormalised: The real headache started when I tried to link my account to UPI. They kept asking for my VPA. I spent a good 30 minutes trying to figure out what that even was! Turns out it was something like myname@bankname. All this just to transfer a measly Rs. 100 to my friend!
normalised: The real headache started when I tried to link my account to U-P-I. They kept asking for my V-P-A. I spent a good thirty minutes trying to figure out what that even was! Turns out it was something like my name at bank name. All this just to transfer a measly rupee one hundred to my friend!

unnormalised: And don't even get me started on the cheque book. They wanted all sorts of information filled in, including the MICR code! It was something like 110202003, printed at the bottom of the cheque. I felt like I needed a degree in finance just to write a cheque. Thank God for online banking now, it’s a lot easier!
normalised: And don't even get me started on the cheque book. They wanted all sorts of information filled in, including the M-I-C-R code! It was something like one one zero two zero two zero zero three, printed at the bottom of the cheque. I felt like I needed a degree in finance just to write a cheque. Thank God for online banking now, it’s a lot easier!

unnormalised: Finally got everything sorted, but boy, was it a ride. Just a reminder to everyone, keep your account number, CIF number, and other banking details safe. The banking process, while a little complicated sometimes, is important for financial safety.
